TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: ?aw anga sun, sinsi.
?aw anga son, sinsi.
S.TRANSL: Greetings to you, teacher.

S.FORM: ka vaivaik anga sun imaza i Hiitu ki sun a nakemuda ta su valisakedan tjanuamen, ła?ua ?i tja ?udain, masa tu matsatsadjatsadja itjen angata.
ka vaivaik anga son imaza i Hiito ki son a nakemoda ta so valisakedan tjanoamen, lja?oa ?i tja ?odain, masa to macacadjacadja itjen angata.
S.TRANSL: When you have left (us) here in Pingtung, how will you be in your concern for us? But what can be done, as we are so far apart.

S.FORM: ka vaivaik sun itua kisia'an ramułu anga men aravats tjanusun a ti sinsi.
ka vaivaik son itoa kisia'an ramoljo anga men aravac tjanoson a ti sinsi.
S.TRANSL: When you left from the railway station we were very sad for you, teacher.

S.FORM: ła?ua aitsu nu napasusu itjen tua tulu nimadju tua pazazekazekatj nimadju ?a imaza i Tayuang, ki tjen a nametsevutsevung anga nu tsuay anga nu tjaivilił anga itua naqemati a Tsemas, ayaya men a masalusalu.

lja?oa aico no napasoso itjen toa tolo nimadjo toa pazazekazekatj nimadjo ?a imaza i Tayoang, ki tjen a namecevocevong anga no coay anga no tjaivililj anga itoa naqemati a Cemas, ayaya men a masalosalo.
S.TRANSL: But we were convinced that if we all fulfil his teaching and his commands while he was in Taiwan, we will meet later on in the future in the place of the creator God.

S.FORM: pai uta, sinsi, ka i vavaw sun tua varukur ki sun a nakemuda, ki sun a nasevalisakedan tjanuamen anga uta, saka ki sun a namalevaleva uta tua zemuker uta tua mare?a tja kaka i Igiris.
pai ota, sinsi, ka i vavaw son toa varokor ki son a nakemoda, ki son a nasevalisakedan tjanoamen anga ota, saka ki son a namalevaleva ota toa zemoker ota toa mare?a tja kaka i Igiris.
S.TRANSL: And also, teacher, while you are on the ship how will you be in your concern for us too? And you will be glad too to reach our brothers and sisters in England.

S.FORM: saka tiamen anga uta, kalevanga ti sinsi a uri djemałun tua mare?a a ?a?a, ayaya men.
saka tiamen anga ota, kalevanga ti sinsi a ori djemaljon toa mare?a a ?a?a, ayaya men.
S.TRANSL: And we too will say: Good for the teacher, he will reach our brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: nu ?ana masa a demut, ?i men a nasałinga ta kidjadjalan tjanusun.
no ?ana masa a demot, ?i men a nasaljinga ta kidjadjalan tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: If it was near we would want to go with you;

S.FORM: ła?ua ?i tja kudain a matsatsadjatsadja itjen a ma?ełang.
lja?oa ?i tja kodain a macacadjacadja itjen a ma?eljang.
S.TRANSL: but what can we do as we are so far apart, as we know?

S.FORM: ła?ua aitsu nu tjałuzuanga sun tua mare?a tja kaka, ki sun a napaqeneqenetj anga tjanuamen.
lja?oa aico no tjaljozoanga son toa mare?a tja kaka, ki son a napaqeneqenetj anga tjanoamen.
S.TRANSL: But when you get there to our brothers and sisters, you will remember us;

S.FORM: nu inulinuli sun ki su inulinulian amen uta.
no inolinoli son ki so inolinolian amen ota.
S.TRANSL: and when you pray you will pray for us too.

S.FORM: saka tiamen uta uła zemangazangal ti sinsi, uła padjalidjalim ti sinsi tu sipangtjez anga tjanuitjen nu tjaivilił, ?i men a ayaya uta nu inuli amen.
saka tiamen ota olja zemangazangal ti sinsi, olja padjalidjalim ti sinsi to sipangtjez anga tjanoitjen no tjaivililj, ?i men a ayaya ota no inoli amen.
S.TRANSL: And when we pray we will say: May the teacher persevere, may the teacher be keen to come back to us later.

S.FORM: sa?a aitsu, sinsi, a mare?a tja matjałałak i zua mare?a tja kaka ?i navenala ?emuda nu djemałun sun.
sa?a aico, sinsi, a mare?a tja matjaljaljak i zoa mare?a tja kaka ?i navenala ?emoda no djemaljon son.
S.TRANSL: And now, teacher, the parents there and our brothers and sisters, I hope they will be well when you reach them.

S.FORM: aitsu nu mapaqeneqenetj ?i sun a ventsivetsik anga tjanuamen sa su pasemalamalavi anga men tu ki nakemuda su zinukeran, tu ki sun a nasułivatj ?emuda i vavaw tua varukur.
aico no mapaqeneqenetj ?i son a vencivecik anga tjanoamen sa so pasemalamalavi anga men to ki nakemoda so zinokeran, to ki son a nasoljivatj ?emoda i vavaw toa varokor.
S.TRANSL: And when you think of us you will write to us and tell us about your arrival, whether you were all right on the ship.

S.FORM: saka aitsu ?i men a ?ałavałava uta tua su vetsik uta, sinsi.
saka aico ?i men a ?aljavaljava ota toa so vecik ota, sinsi.
S.TRANSL: And now we will await your letter, teacher.

S.FORM: nu binkiukiu anga sun uta ?i sun a pasemalamalaw uta tua uri su sipangtjezan anga tjanuamen nu tjaivilił anga.
no binkiokio anga son ota ?i son a pasemalamalaw ota toa ori so sipangtjezan anga tjanoamen no tjaivililj anga.
S.TRANSL: When you have begun studying too you will tell us when you are going to come back to us in the future.

S.FORM: sa?a tia?en uta, sinsi, tua naramałeng a?en aravats aitsu nu mangtjez anga sun nu tjaivilił, nu lemaqets ?i nane?anga.
sa?a tia?en ota, sinsi, toa naramaljeng a?en aravac aico no mangtjez anga son no tjaivililj, no lemaqec ?i nane?anga.
S.TRANSL: And I too, teacher, as I am very old, when you come back in the future perhaps I will not be here (?).

S.FORM: ła?ua nu pasusu anga ?en, nu namakaya ken a kitjałupatsay tua ?u ?inaimazan i ?atsauan, nu ayain a tjaisangas anga tjanusun a sema tinkuku.
lja?oa no pasoso anga ?en, no namakaya ken a kitjaljopacay toa ?o ?inaimazan i ?acaoan, no ayain a tjaisangas anga tjanoson a sema tinkoko.
S.TRANSL: But if I am faithful, if I can endure my time on earth, perhaps (?) I will go to heaven before you.

S.FORM: ła?ua aitsu nu ini anan a pasusu a?en, ?asinu ?i nazemuker tua ?ama i ?alevelevan.
lja?oa aico no ini anan a pasoso a?en, ?asino ?i nazemoker toa ?ama i ?alevelevan.
S.TRANSL: But if I am still not faithful, how can I reach our Father in heaven?

S.FORM: ła?ua aitsu nu sekulukulung amen i maza, ?i sun a napazekatj anga tjanuamen.
lja?oa aico no sekolokolong amen i maza, ?i son a napazekatj anga tjanoamen.
S.TRANSL: But if we here are stupid, you will forgive us.

S.FORM: ?aw anga sun, sinsi.
?aw anga son, sinsi.
S.TRANSL: Greetings, teacher.

S.FORM: djavadjavay a su kipaula tjanuamen ?a imaza anan sun i Tayuang.
djavadjavay a so kipaola tjanoamen ?a imaza anan son i Tayoang.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for your trouble on our behalf while you were still here in Taiwan.
amin
